title: Integration Connectors - Integration Connectors release notes
abstract:
# Integration Connectors - Integration Connectors release notes
This page documents production updates to Integration Connectors. Check this page for announcements about new or updated features, bug fixes, known issues, and deprecated functionality.
You can see the latest product updates for all of Google Cloud on the [  Google Cloud](/release-notes) page, browse and filter all release notes in the [Google Cloud console](https://console.cloud.google.com/release-notes) ,   or programmatically access release notes in [BigQuery](https://console.cloud.google.com/bigquery?p=bigquery-public-data&d=google_cloud_release_notes&t=release_notes&page=table) .
To get the latest product updates delivered to you, add the URL of this page to your [feed   reader](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_feed_aggregators) , or add the feed URL directly: `https://cloud.google.com/feeds/integration-connectors-release-notes.xml`
content:
## March 03, 2024The [event subscription](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/eventsubscription) feature is now [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) .
You can now configure dead-letter in the following connectors:- [IBM MQ](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/ibmmq/configure) 
- [Jira Cloud](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/jiracloud/configure) 
- [Rabbit MQ](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/rabbitmq/configure) 
- [Webhook](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/webhook/configure) 
- [Zendesk](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/zendesk/configure) 
If you configure dead-letter, the connection writes the unprocessed events to your specified [Pub/Sub topic](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/overview) .## February 19, 2024The following connector versions will be deprecated on 20 April, 2024:- [MongoDB (version 1)](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/mongodb/v1/configure) 
- [Oracle DB (version 1)](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/oracledb/v1/configure) 
The support for these connectors will end on 20 April, 2024. It's recommended you start using the **version 2** of these connectors.## February 12, 2024The following connectors are now [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) :- [Acumatica](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/acumatica/configure) 
- [Azure Data Lake](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/azuredatalakestorage/configure) 
- [Couchbase](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/couchbase/configure) 
- [Dynamics 365](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/dynamics365/configure) 
- [Elasticsearch](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/elasticsearch/configure) 
- [Netsuite](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/netsuite/configure) 
- [SAP ERP](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/saperp/configure) 
- [Splunk](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/splunk/configure) 
To view the list of all the GA connectors, see [Connectors in GA](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/all-integration-connectors#connectors-in-general-availability-ga) .## February 04, 2024When you delete a custom connector from the [custom connector page](https://console.cloud.google.com/connectors/custom-connectors) , the page may not work as intended. For more information, see [Known Issues](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/known-issues) .## January 30, 2024 **Custom SQL editor** The custom SQL editor lets you run custom queries across different entities, and is available in the user interface of the following connectors:- [BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/bigquery/configure) 
- [Cloud Spanner](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudspanner/configure) 
- [Cloud SQL for MySQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudsqlformysql/configure) 
- [Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudsqlforpostgresql/configure) 
- [Cloud SQL for SQL Server](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudsqlforsqlserver/configure) 
- [Couchbase](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/couchbase/configure) 
- [Elasticsearch](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/elasticsearch/configure) 
- [MySQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/mysql/configure) 
- [Oracle DB (Version 2)](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/oracledb/v2/configure) 
- [PostgreSQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/postgresql/configure) 
- [Salesforce](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/salesforce/configure) 
- [Snowflake](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/snowflake/configure) 
- [SQL Server](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sqlserver/configure) 
- [Teradata](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/teradata/configure) 
For more information, see [Execute custom SQL query](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/bigquery/configure#execute-custom-query) .## January 29, 2024 **HTTP connector supports OAuth 2.0 - Authorization code** The [HTTP connector](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/http/configure) now supports the [OAuth 2.0 - Authorization code](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-1.3.1) authentication type.## January 24, 2024 **Custom connectors [Preview]** The custom connectors feature (based on the Open API specification) lets you create your own connectors that aren't a part of the standard connectors provided by Integration Connectors, and then use such connectors in your [integrations](https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/overview) . For more information, see [Custom connectors](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/custom-connectors) .
 **Connectors for Google services** The following new connectors are available in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) :- [Cloud Natural Language](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_google_natural_language/configure) 
- [Firestore](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_firestore/configure) 
- [Google Analytics](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_google_analytics/configure) 
- [Google Calendar](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_google_calendar/configure) 
- [Google Data Catalog](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_gcp_datacatalog/configure) 
- [Google Docs](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_google_docs/configure) 
- [Google Drive](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_google_drive/configure) 
- [Google Forms](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_google_forms/configure) 
- [Google Tasks](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_google_tasks/configure) 
- [Google Translate](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_google_translate/configure) 
- [Vertex AI](http://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/gsc_vertex_ai/configure) 
## January 22, 2024The [VPC Service Controls feature for Integration Connectors](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/vpcsc-connectors) is now [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) .## January 17, 2024 **Terraform support** You can now use Terraform to create new connections. For more information, see the individual connector documentation that describes how to use Terraform for creating connections. Also, see the [Connection Terraform resource](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/google/latest/docs/resources/integration_connectors_connection) .## January 16, 2024The [Webhook connector](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/webhook/configure) is now available in preview. This connector lets you listen to events from your backend, and is designed to be used with the [Webhook trigger](https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/configure-webhook-trigger) in [Application Integration](https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/overview) .## January 08, 2024The following connectors are now [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) :- [Amazon S3](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/amazons3/configure) 
- [FTP](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/ftp/configure) 
- [Magento](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/magento/configure) 
- [MySQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/mysql/configure) 
- [PostgreSQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/postgresql/configure) 
- [SAP HANA](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/saphana/configure) 
- [SendGrid](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sendgrid/configure) 
- [SharePoint](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sharepoint/configure) 
- [Workday](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/workday/configure) 
- [Xero](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/xero/configure) 
- [Zoho Books](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/zohobooks/configure) 
To view the list of all the GA connectors, see [Connectors in GA](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/all-integration-connectors#connectors-in-general-availability-ga) .## November 28, 2023Integration Connectors is now available in the following additional regions:- Salt Lake City (`us-west3`)
- Osaka (`asia-northeast2`)
- Seoul (`asia-northeast3`)
- Jakarta (`asia-southeast2`)
- Hong Kong (`asia-east2`)
- Dammam (`me-central2`)
For the list of all the supported regions, see [Locations](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/locations) .## November 23, 2023 [Event subscription](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/hubspot/configure) support available for the HubSpot connector.You can leverage the event subscription feature in this connector through the new [HubSpot trigger](https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/configure-hubspot-trigger) available in [Application Integration](https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/overview) .## November 21, 2023 [Event subscription](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/eventsubscription) support available for the [IBM MQ](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/ibmmq/configure) and the [Rabbit MQ](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/rabbitmq/configure) connectors.You can leverage the event subscription feature in these connectors through the new [IBM MQ trigger](https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/configure-ibmmq-trigger) and the [Rabbit MQ trigger](https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/configure-rabbitmq-trigger) that are available in the [Application Integration](https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/overview) .
The following connectors are now [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) :- [Freshbooks](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/freshbooks/configure) 
- [Cloud Storage](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudstorage/configure) 
- [HubSpot](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/hubspot/configure) 
- [IBM MQ](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/ibmmq/configure) 
- [Oracle DB (Version 2)](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/oracledb/configure) 
- [Rabbit MQ](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/rabbitmq/configure) 
- [Zuora](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/zuora/configure) 
To view the list of all the GA connectors, see [Connectors in GA](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/all-integration-connectors#connectors-in-general-availability-ga) .## October 19, 2023 **Static outbound IP address support** You can now configure static outbound IP address for your connections. By using the static IP addresses in your firewall, you can restrict access to your backend systems, which in turn makes the connectivity more secure. For more information, see [Configure static outbound IP addresses for connections](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/configure-static-ip) .## October 13, 2023The following connectors are now [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) :- [Box](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/box/configure) 
- [LDAP](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/ldap/configure) 
- [Shopify](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/shopify/configure) 
- [Zendesk](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/zendesk/configure) 
To view the list of all the GA connectors, see [Connectors in GA](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/all-integration-connectors#connectors-in-general-availability-ga) .## October 10, 2023 **IAM Conditions for fine-grained access** You can now add IAM Conditions for the following resources:- Connection
- ManagedZone
- EndpointAttachment
- EventSubscription
- ConnectionSchemaMetadata
For more information, see [IAM Conditions for fine-grained access](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/add-connector-iam-conditions) .## September 12, 2023The following connectors are now [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) :- [Redshift](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/redshift/configure) 
- [SAP SuccessFactors](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sapsuccessfactors/configure) 
- [Twilio](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/twilio/configure) 
- [BigCommerce](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/bigcommerce/configure) 
To view the list of all the GA connectors, see [Connectors in GA](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/all-integration-connectors#connectors-in-general-availability-ga) .## September 11, 2023Integration Connectors now supports rate limiting for the connection traffic. For more information, see [Apply rate limiting](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/rate-limiting) .## August 29, 2023Starting with this release, you must specify a protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) when configuring the backend hostname for your [Jira Cloud connection](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/jiracloud/configure#configure-the-connector) . Prior to this release, specifying the protocol was optional, and you might have configured a connection without the protocol for the hostname. Note the following behavior for your existing Jira Cloud connections that don't have the protocol for the hostname:- If your backend uses HTTPS, you don't have to make any changes to your Jira Cloud connection, as it will use HTTPS by default.
- If your backend uses HTTP, you must edit your connection, and add the HTTP protocol for the hostname configuration.
## August 09, 2023The following connectors are now generally available (GA):- [AlloyDB](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/alloydb/configure) 
- [Apache Kafka](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/apachekafka/configure) 
- [Jira Cloud](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/jiracloud/configure) 
- [MariaDB](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/mariadb/configure) 
- [SAP Gateway](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sapgateway/configure) 
- [Snowflake](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/snowflake/configure) 
To view the list of all the GA connectors, see [Connectors in General Availability](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/all-integration-connectors#connectors-in-general-availability-ga) .## July 20, 2023MongoDB (version 2), ServiceNow, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud connectors are now generally available. Including these connectors, the following 13 connectors are generally available:- [BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/bigquery/configure) 
- [Cloud SQL for MySQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudsqlformysql/configure) 
- [Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudsqlforpostgresql/configure) 
- [Cloud SQL for SQL Server](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudsqlforsqlserver/configure) 
- [HTTP](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/http/configure) 
- [MongoDB v2](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/mongodb/v2/configure) 
- [Pub/Sub](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/pubsub/configure) 
- [Redis](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/redis/configure) 
- [Salesforce](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/salesforce/configure) 
- [Salesforce Marketing Cloud](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/salesforcemarketingcloud/configure) 
- [ServiceNow](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/servicenow/configure) 
- [SFTP](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sftp/configure) 
- [SQL Server](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sqlserver/configure) 
The following connectors are now available in public [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) :- [AlloyDB](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/alloydb/configure) 
- [Authorize.Net](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/authorize.net/configure) 
- [EnterpriseDB](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/enterprisedb/configure) 
- [FinancialForce](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/financialforce/configure) 
Integration Connectors now supports [VPC Service Controls](https://cloud.google.com/vpc-service-controls/docs/overview) for enhanced security. For more information, see [Set up VPC Service Controls for Integration Connectors ](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/vpcsc-connectors) .
Support for [event subscriptions](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/eventsubscription) from your backend applications. By using event subscriptions, you can trigger your integrations based on the events in your backend applications. For more information, see [Use event subscriptions in your integrations](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/eventsubscription#esi) . **Note** : The event subscription feature is available in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) .
The topic name input parameter is now optional in the [Publish message action](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/pubsub/configure#cja) of the Pub/Sub connector. Therefore, by parameterizing the topic name, you can use a single connection to access multiple Pub/Sub topics.## July 01, 2023Starting July 1, 2023, you will be billed for usage of a [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) connector version as per the prices mentioned in the [pricing page](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/pricing) . To know when a connector version has moved from preview to general availability, you can use of the following approaches:- Subscribe to the [Integration Connector release notifications](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/release-notes) .
- Regularly check for the presence of the **Preview** label next to the connector name in the [List connections page](https://console.cloud.google.com/connectors/connections) . If a connector doesn't have the **Preview** label, it means that the connector is generally available.
To view the list of all the generally available connectors, see [Integration Connectors in GA](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/release-notes#June_13_2023) . **Note** : You aren't billed for using connectors that are in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) .## June 13, 2023Integration Connectors is now [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) , and the billing cycle will start from July 1, 2023, onwards.Integration Connectors let you connect to various data sources from your [integrations](https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/overview) . With these connectors, you can access both Google Cloud services and other business applications seamlessly. For the list of all the available connectors, see [all Integration Connectors](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/all-integration-connectors) . **Note** : Some of the connectors are available only in preview mode.
Cloud SQL for SQL Server, HTTP, Redis, SFTP, and SQL Server connectors are now generally available. Including these connectors, the following 10 connectors are generally available:- [BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/bigquery/configure) 
- [Cloud SQL for MySQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudsqlformysql/configure) 
- [Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudsqlforpostgresql/configure) 
- [Cloud SQL for SQL Server](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudsqlforsqlserver/configure) 
- [HTTP](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/http/configure) 
- [Pub/Sub](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/pubsub/configure) 
- [Redis](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/redis/configure) 
- [Salesforce](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/salesforce/configure) 
- [SFTP](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sftp/configure) 
- [SQL Server](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sqlserver/configure) 
Support for proxy server configuration in the [SQL Server connector](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sqlserver/configure) .## June 01, 2023Integration Connectors is now available in the following additional regions:- Doha (`me-central1`)
- Tel Aviv (`me-west1`)
For the list of all the supported regions, see [Locations](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/locations) .## May 29, 2023Support for proxy configuration in the following connectors:- [Apache CouchDB](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/apachecouchdb/configure) 
- [BigCommerce](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/bigcommerce/configure) 
- [BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/bigquery/configure) 
- [Box](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/box/configure) 
- [Couchbase](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/couchbase/configure) 
- [Dynamics NAV](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/dynamicsnav/configure) 
- [Elasticsearch](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/elasticsearch/configure) 
- [Email](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/email/configure) 
- [HTTP](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/http/configure) 
- [HubSpot](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/hubspot/configure) 
- [Jira Cloud](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/jiracloud/configure) 
- [Kintone](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/kintone/configure) 
- [Magento](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/magento/configure) 
- [MailChimp](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/mailchimp/configure) 
- [Neo4J](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/neo4j/configure) 
- [PayPal](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/paypal/configure) 
- [PostgreSQL](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/postgresql/configure) 
- [Redshift](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/redshift/configure) 
- [Salesforce](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/salesforce/configure) 
- [SAP Netweaver Gateway](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/sapgateway/configure) 
- [ServiceNow](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/servicenow/configure) 
- [Shopify](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/shopify/configure) 
- [Snowflake](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/snowflake/configure) 
- [Splunk](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/splunk/configure) 
- [Streak](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/streak/configure) 
- [Stripe](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/stripe/configure) 
- [TaxJar](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/taxjar/configure) 
- [Trello](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/trello/configure) 
- [Twilio](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/twilio/configure) 
- [Workday](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/workday/configure) 
- [Zendesk](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/zendesk/configure) 
## May 23, 2023 [MongoDB (Version 2) connector](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/mongodb/v2/configure) This release provides the MongoDB (Version 2) connector that has support for **queryable encryption** .
Support for **Digest** authentication and **TLS chiper suites** in the [HTTP connector](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/http/configure#chiper-suite) .
Support for **PublishMessage** action in the **Apache Kafka** connector. This action lets you publish messages to a Kafka topic, and also lets you validate your messages against the message schema defined in the schema registry for a topic. For more information, see [PublishMessage action](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/apachekafka/configure#cja) .## May 15, 2023Starting with this release, you can't configure a service attachment as a destination type. Your existing connections that use service attachments will continue to work as before, but they won't be supported from July 01, 2023 onwards. So, it is recommended that you start using [endpoint attachments](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/create-ep-attachment) for private connectivity.
Integration Connectors are now available in the following additional locations:- Melbourne (`australia-southeast2`)
- Finland (`europe-north1`)
For the list of all the supported locations, see [Locations](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/locations) .
DNS peering support for TLS terminationThis feature enables SSL hostname validation at your backend. Hence, you can now configure your connectors to connect to your private backend services using a hostname. For more information, see [Create an endpoint attachment as a hostname](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/create-ep-attachment#create-ep-hostname) .
Support for **SignURL** action in the [Cloud Storage connector](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudstorage/configure#signurl) .## April 12, 2023Support for Cloud Logging in Integration Connectors. For more information, see [View connector logs](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/logging) .
Pay-as-you-go customers can now customize the minimum and maximum number of nodes for a connection. A node is a unit (or replica) of a connection that processes transactions. More nodes are required to process more transactions for a connection and conversely, fewer nodes are required to process fewer transactions. To understand how the nodes affect your connector pricing, see [Pricing for connection nodes](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/pricing#pricing-for-connection-nodes) .
The Box connector now supports **OAuth 2.0 - Authorization code** authentication. For more information, see [Configure authentication](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/box/configure#configure-auth) .
Support for the following actions in the BigQuery connector:- CancelJob
- GetJob
- InsertJob
- InsertLoadJob
For more information, see [BigQuery actions](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/bigquery/configure#actions) .
The [Integration Connectors UI](https://console.cloud.google.com/connectors) now has a new **Overview** page that provides the following information:- Overview of Integration Connectors
- Recent connections
- Documentation links
The **Overview** page is the default landing page for the Integration Connectors UI.
Atlas support for the MongoDB connector. For information, see [Configuration for the MongoDB Atlas cluster](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/mongodb/configure#configuration-for-the-mongodb-atlas-cluster) .
Confluent support for the Apache Kafka connector. For more information, see [Configuration for Confluent Cloud](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/apachekafka/configure#configuration-for-confluent-cloud) .
Support for executing stored procedures in connectors. For the list of all the connectors that support the execution of stored procedures, see [Execute a stored procedure](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/examples/execute-stored-proc) .## March 01, 2023 **New connectors available in preview** The following new connectors are available in preview:- [HTTP](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/http/configure) (includes SSL support)
- [RabbitMQ](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/rabbitmq/configure) 
The [IBM MQ](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/ibmmq/configure) connector now supports [requestReply](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/ibmmq/configure#reqreply) messages.
The [Cloud Storage](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/cloudstorage/configure#actions) connector now supports the following actions for file operations:- UploadObject
- DownloadObject
- MoveObject
- CopyObject
- DeleteObject
The [MongoDB](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/mongodb/configure) connector now supports the following actions:- InsertDocument
- UpdateDocument
- DeleteDocument
- GetDocument
## January 04, 2023 **New connectors available in preview** The following new connectors are available in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) :- [HubSpot](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/hubspot/configure) 
- [Magento](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/magento/configure) 
- [Teradata](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connectors/teradata/configure)

## September 28, 2022Integration Connectors are now available in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) . Integration Connectors let you connect to various data sources from your integrations. With connectors, both Google Cloud services and third-party business applications are exposed to your integrations through a transparent, standard interface. As an integration developer, you can quickly connect to a growing pool of applications and systems without the need for protocol-specific knowledge or the use of custom code.For more information about the Integration Connectors features and functionalities, see [Integration Connectors documentation](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs) .For the complete list of all the available connectors, see [Connector reference](https://cloud.google.com/integration-connectors/docs/connector-reference-overview) . **Note:** Rollouts of this release will begin today and may take four or more business days to be completed across all Google Cloud zones. You may not be able to provision Integration Connectors until the rollout is complete.
